text:
One of the technologies that are the most used theses days in the Information-Communication sector are the Social Networks. These are now everywhere in our everyday lives. A majority of the worldwide population use it every day and I personnaly use it almost every hours, expect when I sleep of course. In the information-communication sector, we can find for exemple the media on almost every social networks. But these are not the only entities of the information-communication sector that are present on those. We can barely go on a social network without seeing an advertising. Almost all companies are using them for their intern and extern communication campaign. Those are also a ressource space for journalist and reporter to find usefull informations for their work. By definition, social networks are exculsively a space of communication.
 This Technology is very important for the evolution of the information-communication sector and it has already changed it drastically. For exemple, like I said before, all old medias (TV, radio, etc.) have now a personnal page on one or several social networks. And obviously it leaded to create new jobs, like community manager for exemple. But, to continue on the use of this technology by the media, this also leaded to a new form of communication. Now that we can share information almost immediatly, we want informations about a fact at the same time than the fact is happening. So it leads sometimes to the circulation of non-verify facts, or like Mr Alex Dupont loved to say : fake-news. Moreover, it impacts the own definition of journalism, because today everyone can, in a certain way, be a journalist, a reporter. And if everybody can expose their opinions using social networks on the internet so those had also changed the political communication sector. First of all because all politics have now personal pages on different social networks but also because each person can influence other by using them and create quickly their own supportive community for exemple.
